steps.name: Define Audit Parameters
tasks: Identify applicable Trust Services Criteria for your organization.
Specify all systems, data, personnel, and software within audit scope.
Choose an appropriate audit timeframe (3, 6, 9, or 12 months).

steps.name: Assess Risk Landscape
tasks: Catalog all information assets and their associated risks.
Calculate the probability of each identified risk occurring.
Measure potential business impact from each identified risk.
Prioritize risks based on their overall organizational impact.
Develop specific treatment plans for each identified risk.
Document gaps in existing security controls through manual or automated assessment.

steps.name: Develop Remediation Strategy
tasks: Implement or modify controls to address all identified security gaps.
Assign ownership and remediation timelines for each risk and control.

steps.name: Establish Control Framework
tasks: Update all security policies and controls and distribute to employees for review.
Conduct comprehensive security awareness training for all personnel.
Communicate potential disciplinary consequences for security requirement violations.

steps.name: Compile Audit Materials
tasks: Gather and organize all policy documentation and evidence screenshots throughout the audit window.

steps.name: Validate Audit Readiness
tasks: Optionally engage a service auditor to perform a readiness assessment and implement their recommendations.
Conduct internal readiness evaluation by mapping controls to chosen Trust Services Criteria and addressing any gaps.

steps.name: Execute Formal Audit
tasks: Engage an accredited SOC 2 auditor to perform the Type II audit.
Implement all auditor feedback and recommendations.

steps.name: Sustain Compliance Program
tasks: Schedule regular management reviews (minimum annually, quarterly recommended).
Perform annual risk assessment processes.
Monitor control effectiveness continuously to ensure ongoing policy alignment.
Track emerging or escalating risks and implement updated security controls.
Document all compliance exceptions and verify corrective actions through completion.
Schedule SOC audits at 12-month intervals.
